title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

reading.title: Làm bài luyện đọc | Luyện đề VSTEP

passages.content:
Câu 1: When do westerners typically do their volunteering?
A. After graduating from university
B. While looking for a suitable job
C. Between secondary school and upper secondary school
D. Between leaving school and starting university
Câu 2: Which of the following would best describe the present attitude towards volunteering abroad?
A. Frightened
B. Changing
C. Frustrated
D. Disapproving
Câu 3: What is “More often than not” in paragraph (A) closest in meaning to?
A. All the time
B. Most of the time
C. For a time
D. Sometimes
Câu 4: According to the writer, which of the following statements is true about volunteering abroad?
A. The nature of volunteering abroad is claimed to make money for profit.
B. The need for volunteers in developing countries has grown for the past few years.
C. There are usually purposeful placements in volunteering abroad for profit aims.
D. Commercial purposes may be hidden under the claim of humane purposes of volunteering.
Câu 5: What does the word “These” in paragraph (B) refer to?
A. Drawbacks of voluntourism
B. Studies on voluntourism
C. Demands for voluntourism
D. Advantages of voluntourism
Câu 6: What are children being kept in inadequate living conditions for?
A. To show the poverty of these places
B. To reflect their real living standards
C. To legally implement children trafficking
D. To get voluntary contributions from visitors
Câu 7: According to the passage, what does Mark Watson expect to see regarding volunteering abroad?
A. A positive transformation in volunteers’ attitudes
B. A sense of realism for the volunteers abroad
C. An acknowledgement from potential volunteers
D. A good support from potential volunteers
Câu 8: What message does Mark Watson want to pass to future volunteers through the idea of digging wells?
A. Would-be volunteers should think more about doing unskilled work.
B. It is not rational to think that volunteering abroad is to help the poor.
C. Volunteers cannot do anything worthy if they only do unskilled wo

options.C: Between secondary school and upper secondary school
options.D: Between leaving school and starting university

options.C: Volunteers cannot do anything worthy if they only do unskilled work.
options.D: Volunteering abroad requires thinking about what is actually needed.

options.A: This process may lead to significant changes in voluntourism to eliminate possible harm to developing countries.
options.B: The whole process can reveal a real face to poverty and vulnerability, and shift consciousness toward the understanding of a shared humanity.
options.C: That is to say, volunteering abroad mainly requires the youth enthusiasm if they want to make a real contribution.
options.D: A sense of humanity and sympathy is highly appreciated to make volunteering abroad worthwhile in every case.
